name: As Stubborn as a Mule Quiz | Animals for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
fox.

	"Sly" means "sneaky." Foxes have to be sneaky so they can sneak up on their prey. They eat small animals like mice.

ox.

	Oxen are large, strong cows. In some countries people use them to pull heavy carts and farm machines. An ostrich is a huge, long-legged bird that can't fly, and an ocelot is a big wild cat with beautiful spotted fur.

mouse.

	Mice are sometimes not so quiet--when they skitter around on wood floors, their bitty little claws make noise.

lion.

	If you saw the movie "The Wizard of Oz," you know that lions can be cowardly, too.

clam or lark.

	When I wrote this quiz I had no idea how the saying "happy as a clam" started. (How can people possibly know whether or not clams are happy?) But a player points out that, if you draw a clam, you will see that it looks as if it is always smiling!

owl.

	I guess owls' round, flat faces and big staring eyes make them look wise. They hunt at night and they are always asking, "Whoooo?"

lamb.

	Llamas are wooly, camel-like animals. Leopards and lynxes are big cats that are NOT gentle (except maybe with their babies). Can you name the nursery rhyme that has a lamb in it?

peacock.

	Peacocks have huge colorful tail feathers. They open them up to form a giant, showy fan of feathers. They do this to attract females (peahens), not because they are conceited. A pangolin is like an armadillo--it has scaly armor even though it is a mammal.

kitten.

	Kittens are weaker than people, but my kitten Jack is pretty strong. He is always knocking things over. My big dog Lisa is afraid of him.

questions.text: If you act shy, someone might ask, "_______ got your tongue?"
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	It would hurt if a cat got your tongue!
